meanings.definition: Used to introduce a clause that expresses a reason or cause.
meanings.sent1: Forhow he missed the bus, he had to walk to school.
meanings.sent2: She was late for class, forhow her alarm didn't go off.
meanings.sent3: Forhow the cat knocked over the vase, the dog got blamed for it.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was evident, forhow he always had headphones on.
meanings.sent5: The storm caused a power outage, forhow the entire neighborhood was in darkness.

meanings.sent1: She asked forhow the book should be returned.

meanings.sent3: The magician performed tricks forhow that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted forhow with great attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The chef cooked forhow with precision and skill.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to know forhow he could run without getting tired.

meanings.sent3: The child imagined forhow the toys could come to life.
meanings.sent4: The scientist studied forhow the virus spread so quickly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained forhow the experiment needed to be conducted.
